text: With Blumhouse, I was really hoping for something more serious and subdued.  I had faith that they were going to correct the wrongs from the last remake.  But this trailer... 1. Looks just like the 2006 remake. 2. Shows way too much of the killer. 3. Shows way too much of the movie. 4. Gives away a possible Free Masons, Skulls, Illuminati secret elite society subplot that was never part of the original story or which could've been a surprise. 5. Obnoxious suped up renditions of Christmas songs to make it more "hip" & "trendy" with "in your face" giant graphics rather than trusting the source material and create a sense of dread.  Blumhouse or Universal needs to fire their marketing department guys, because those editors are not doing the films and/ or their filmmakers any favors.

text: No offense, but it upsets me that people are making scary movies about Christmas. Christmas is about the celebration of having a good time with your family and/or friends, not about a case of crime or people getting killed. But most importantly Christmas is about celebrating Jesus's birthday for he gave up his life to save all of our lives. If you are reading this comment and are getting upset that I'm religious, all I ask is to not give out mean comments about my beliefs for this is just an opinion that I thought everyone should realize. I just hope one day that people will realize that sometimes you should give scary movies a break for it's the season to be joy not scary things. Cuz Halloween is over now, it's Christmas's time to shine. I'm not saying that you should believe what I'm saying, all I'm saying is just an opinion and that's all. If you are reading this I ask that you have a great Christmas and to stay safe out there. Have a wonderful day everyone üòÖüëç
